concept: Scenario-based design questions for a social media feed.

challenges.title: Q1: Feed Requirements & Data Flow
challenges.description: Design a simple news feed for a social network. Define what data needs to be stored for posts and follows, and describe how data flows from a user posting something to that post appearing in followers' feeds.
challenges.outputDescription: High-level description of entities (User, Post, Follow, Feed) and data flow (checked manually).
examples: Mention that when a user posts, the system may push it to follower feeds (fan-out on write) or compute on read.
challenges.starterCode: // Describe entities, relationships, and posting-to-feed flow.

challenges.title: Q2: Fan-out Choices & Caching
challenges.description: Explain fan-out on write vs fan-out on read in the context of feeds. Which approach would you pick for: (a) a user with few followers, (b) a celebrity with millions of followers? How would you use caching to speed up feed loading?
challenges.outputDescription: Comparison of fan-out strategies and caching plan (checked manually).
examples: Think about precomputing feeds for normal users and dynamic feed generation for celebrities.
challenges.starterCode: // Compare fan-out approaches and explain caching strategy (per-user feed cache, etc.).
